solution_line_template: The total marks of science and music are {science_marks}+{music_marks} = <<{science_marks}+{music_marks}={science_and_music_total}>>{science_and_music_total}

When you add the marks she scored in social studies, the full marks become {science_and_music_total}+{social_studies_marks} = <<{science_and_music_total}+{social_studies_marks}={total_after_social_studies}>>{total_after_social_studies}.
She scored half as many marks in physics as she scored music, totaling {physics_fraction_numerator}/{physics_fraction_denominator}*{music_marks} = {physics_marks} marks.

When you add the marks she scored in physics to the total marks of the other subjects, the full marks become {total_after_social_studies}+{physics_marks} = <<{total_after_social_studies}+{physics_marks}={final_total_marks}>>{final_total_marks}
